  sgcool_label_text: Pantjangan Pertama is another folio of linocut prints following Apin’s collaboration with Baharoedin in 1946. Funded by the Gelanggang collective this time round
 it consists of 12 works on paper. Featuring a collection of images of objects and people going about their daily activities
 they represent the ‘daily realities’ of the different societies within the Indonesian community.\r\n\r\nDuring the post-WW II period
 the print medium was generally associated with the Social Realist art movements

 though maintaining the socialist bent is as much
 if not more
 about the print medium itself as a possible new direction in modern Indonesian art. Culturally dominated by paintings
 Apin’s folio of prints and the activities of the Gelanggang collective are testament towards this push.

metadata.title_text: Pantjangan Pertama The First Signpost Lompat Tinggi
metadata.physical_appearance: This linocut print depicts a girl performing a high jump. The artist's initials can be found on the bottom left corner. It is noticeable that the paper is browning.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Prints, Indonesian Apin, Mochtar Social realism Jumping Indonesians Figurative art
metadata.sgcool_label_text:
Pantjangan Pertama is another folio of linocut prints following Apin’s collaboration with Baharoedin in 1946. Funded by the Gelanggang collective this time round, it consists of 12 works on paper. Featuring a collection of images of objects and people going about their daily activities, they represent the ‘daily realities’ of the different societies within the Indonesian community.

During the post-WW II period, the print medium was generally associated with the Social Realist art movements, looking at the few examples in Southeast Asia. Apin’s prints works, though maintaining the socialist bent is as much, if not more, about the print medium itself as a possible new direction in modern Indonesian art. Culturally dominated by paintings, Apin’s folio of prints and the activities of the Gelanggang collective are testament towards this push.
